SENT.plain: PURPOSE: To evaluate magnetic resonance (MR) angiography and MR imaging in assessment of moyamoya disease
MATERIALS AND METHODS: The cases of 26 patients with moyamoya disease were evaluated prospectively
After three-dimensional time-of-flight 1.5-T MR angiography and MR imaging, images were evaluated in blinded separate interpretation
RESULTS: MR angiography and MR imaging accurately depicted 217 (82%) and 184 (70%) of 264 arteries, respectively, but the degree of stenosis was overestimated in the other arteries
Basal cerebral moyamoya vessels were depicted in all 52 hemispheres with conventional angiography and in 42 (81%) and 48 (92%) hemispheres with MR angiography and MR imaging, respectively
The respective sensitivity and specificity for diagnosis of moyamoya disease were 73% and 100% for MR angiography, 92% and 100% for MR imaging, and 92% and 100% for MR angiography plus MR imaging
CONCLUSION: Assessment of moyamoya disease is most thorough with MR angiography and MR imaging
